peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to identify antique glass paperweights?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Some weights have tiny canes included that help identify the maker and date. For example, the lot shown below has a small cane with the initial B and the date, 1848. Clichy has an easily identifiable rose cane that they use over and over in their millefiori compositions.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Collecting Guide: 7 things to know about glass paperweights

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to tell if a paperweight is valuable at home?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
THE PRIMARY FACTORS INFLUENCING THE VALUE OF ANTIQUE PAPERWEIGHTS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:
1
Maker (French are generally the most valuable)
2
Rarity of the design (the more rare the design, the more valuable)
3
Symmetry and centering of the design (the more symmetrical, the more valuable)
peopleAlsoAsk.title: The Crown Jewels - Paperweight Collectors Association

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What are the most valuable paperweights?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The finest and most sought-after were made by three French factories – Baccarat, Clichy and St Louis – which only produced paperweights during this short period. Today, it is paperweights made by these three companies that remain the most prized examples at auction.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Glass Paperweights | Tennants Auctioneers

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you tell the age of a paperweight?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Identifying Antique Glass Paperweights According to Christie's Auction House, some antique paperweights include tiny canes that are used to help identify the maker and the date, such as ones arranged to read out a year and a company or maker's initials.
